intro: Licania micrantha var. triandra, commonly known as the red-stemmed licania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
